title: One font to ID (NY Mets) and one font to locate (Henley Script)
content:
Okay, can anyone ID the interlocking “NY” in the NY Mets logo? I’m also looking for a font called Henley Script? It resembles “Stephanie Marie”, but less weight and lean...

 [‹ (x) Chunky Arts House logo - Leviathan {Geoff}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924092942/http:/typophile.com/node/19466 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Bear Country U.S.A. - (Koch) Neuland {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924092942/http:/typophile.com/node/19508 "Go to next forum topic")
author: northern_state

comments.content:
Almost certainly custom. Read [question 16](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924092942/http:/typophile.com/forums/typeid/faq/#Q_16) of the [FAQ](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924092942/http:/typophile.com/forums/typeid/faq).

- Lex

P.S. As for Henley Script, I don’t know.
The interlocking NY from the Mets uniform was from the 1960s (taken from the original NY Giants baseball team)...I was assuming somebody has taken the initiative since the 60s to turn it into a font.
I fear not. :^/ Sorry we can’t be more helpful.
